{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3403979,"name":"James ","username":"TullE564","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tulle564/{size}/226301_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-30T18:40:42.238Z","cooked":"

Over the offseason, I am trying to learn Java with no prior programming knowledge. My coach gave me an XRP to use to do this, and I have downloaded all of the necessary software (I Hope) and found the example code on WPIlib. I am trying to connect the bot to my PC via WiFi, but the network won’t pop up. Possible explanations?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-06-30T18:40:42.238Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":280,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":1435.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468184,"topic_slug":"connecting-an-xrp","display_username":"James ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60429,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Driver"},"post_url":"/t/connecting-an-xrp/468184/1","custom_user_title":"Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3403986,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-30T19:01:10.336Z","cooked":"

It is fairly straightforward if you are using the example code and the XRP WPIlib firmware. GitHub - wpilibsuite/xrp-wpilib-firmware

You have to first flash the XRP firmware by copying the uf2 file onto the pico. You can see the README for instructions. Then you should be able to find the XRP wifi SSID and connect to it with the default password.

Then if you have the WPIlib example code you run the simulation. While it is running you’ll need to select the TeleOp mode to be able to drive the XRP. Occaisionally they haven’t connected like I thought and usually I’ll restart one, but mostly they connect that way.

This is telling me to plug my XRP into my computer. I don’t believe mine has any USB ports, as it is battery operated. I may be completely wrong and misunderstanding you and the article. This setup is like another language to me. What am I doing wrong?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-06-30T20:16:48.424Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468184,"topic_slug":"connecting-an-xrp","display_username":"James ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":2695,"username":"ngreen","name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60429,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Driver"},"post_url":"/t/connecting-an-xrp/468184/3","custom_user_title":"Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3404038,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-30T21:51:56.383Z","cooked":"

It definitely has a USB port, but it’s likely a MicroUSB (I dont have one in front of me to confirm).

That said, we can’t really say what you’re doing wrong without knowing what you’re doing. @ngreen’s comment is spot-on, and the official docs should be referenced to fill in any gaps. If you’re still having issues, please describe, in as much detail as possible, exactly what you’ve done leading to that point, what you’re expecting to happen, what is happening, and why you believe it’s incorrect.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-06-30T21:51:56.383Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":468184,"topic_slug":"connecting-an-xrp","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60429,"username":"TullE564","name":"James ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tulle564/{size}/226301_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/connecting-an-xrp/468184/4","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3404128,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-01T03:27:42.988Z","cooked":"

This is the micro USB cable and pico port you connect to. The cables were popular phone charge cables before USB-C took over a few years ago.

Screenshot_2024-06-30-22-22-44-844691×682 71.7 KB

I would plug the pico in first, then hold bootsel button on the pico, and the plug the USB cable into the laptop. You can release the button and then should be able to access the folder and transfer the firmware file.
